info.name: FyndRX API
info.description:
Complete API collection for FyndRX e-Pharmacy Platform

**Authentication:**
- **Public Browsing Endpoints** (API key only):
  • Drug search & viewing
  • Pharmacy search & prices
  • Reviews (viewing only)
  • Forms (viewing only)
  • Recent/Top searched drugs
  • Blog posts
  • Authentication endpoints
  • Consultations (create, stats, by type)
  • Stats & Analytics (platform, search, user behavior, revenue, content, pharmacy/drug performance, real-time)

- **Authenticated Endpoints** (Bearer token required):
  • User profile & settings
  • Cart operations
  • Orders
  • Prescriptions (user-specific)
  • Consultations (full CRUD + actions)
  • Reviews (create/update/delete)
  • Favorites (drugs & pharmacies - add, remove, list, check, bulk operations)
  • Saved drugs (legacy endpoints)
  • Recently viewed (user-specific)
  • Notifications

**Setup:**
1. Set API_KEY in your .env file
2. Set the api_key variable in Postman collection
3. Login to get access_token for authenticated endpoints

**Pagination:**
Most list endpoints now support pagination with 'page' and 'per_page' query parameters. Default per_page is 15. All paginated responses follow the format:
```json
{
  "data": [...],
  "meta": {
    "current_page": 1,
    "per_page": 15,
    "total": 100,
    "last_page": 7,
    "from": 1,
    "to": 15
  }
}
```

**Stats & Analytics:**
All stats endpoints support date range filtering with 'period' parameter (today, week, month, year, last_7_days, last_30_days, last_90_days, all) or custom range with 'from' and 'to' date parameters (YYYY-MM-DD format).

**Favorites:**
Favorites endpoints allow users to save drugs and pharmacies for quick access. Drugs are stored in saved_drugs table, pharmacies are stored in user's favorite_pharmacies JSON column. Supports bulk operations for efficiency.

variable.description: API key for public endpoints (set in .env as API_KEY)

item.name: Authentication
item.description: Endpoints for user registration, authentication, and security management.

request.description:
# 📱 Send Registration OTP

Initiate the registration or password reset process by sending an OTP to the user's phone.

### Usage
Call this endpoint first when a user wants to sign up or reset their password.

### Required Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `phone_number` | string | The user's mobile number. Formats like `024...` or `+233...` are accepted. |

### Optional Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `email` | string | Backup email address. |
| `reset_password` | boolean | Set to `true` if this is for a password reset flow. Checks if user exists. |

# ✅ Verify OTP

Verify the OTP sent to the user's phone.

### Usage
Call this after the user enters the code they received.

### Required Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `phone_number` | string | The number the OTP was sent to. |
| `otp` | string | The 4-6 digit code received. |

# 📝 Complete Registration

Create a new user account after successful phone verification.

### Usage
Submit this form to create the account. Requires the valid OTP again for security confirmation.

### Required Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `firstname` | string | User's first name. |
| `lastname` | string | User's last name. |
| `email` | email | Unique email address. |
| `phone_number` | string | Unique phone number. |
| `password` | string | Min 8 characters. |
| `otp` | string | The valid OTP code for final verification. |

# 🔓 Login

Authenticate a user and retrieve an access token.

### Auto-Configuration
> **Note:** This request automatically sets the `access_token` collection variable upon success. You don't need to copy-paste it manually!

### Inputs
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `login` | string | **Required**. Either an **Email** or **Phone Number**. |
| `password` | string | **Required**. User's password. |

# 🔐 Reset Password

Set a new password for the user.

### Flow
1. Call `Send OTP` with `reset_password: true`.
2. User receives code.
3. Call this endpoint with the code and new password.

### Required Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `phone_number` | string | User's phone. |
| `otp` | string | Verification code. |
| `password` | string | New password (min 8 chars). |
| `password_confirmation` | string | Must match `password`. |

# ⚠️ Delete Account

Permanently delete a user account.

### Warning
This action is irreversible. All user data, including order history and profiles, will be removed or anonymized.

### Requirements
User must provide their password to confirm deletion.

# 👋 Logout

Invalidate the current access token.

### Headers
Requires `Authorization: Bearer <token>`.

# 🧪 Test Registration

**DEVELOPMENT ONLY**

Skip SMS verification to quickly create a test user.

item.name: User Profile
item.description: Manage user account details, profile pictures, and settings.

request.description:
# 👤 Get Profile

Retrieve the authenticated user's profile information.

### Response Includes
*   Basic info (Name, Email, Phone)
*   Member ID
*   Profile Picture URL
*   Address
*   Favorite Pharmacies

# ✏️ Update Profile

Update personal information.

### Supports Partial Updates
You can send only the fields you want to change.

### Mutable Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `firstname` | string | First Name |
| `lastname` | string | Last Name |
| `email` | email | Must be unique. |
| `phone_number` | string | Must be unique. |
| `dob` | date | Date of Birth (YYYY-MM-DD or string). |
| `address` | string | Physical address. |

formdata.description: Image file (jpeg, png, jpg, gif, max 2MB)

request.description:
# 📸 Upload Picture

Set a profile picture for the first time.

### Requirements
*   **Format**: JPEG, PNG, JPG, GIF
*   **Max Size**: 2MB

# 🔄 Replace Picture

Replace the existing profile picture.

### Logic
Deletes the old image from storage before saving the new one.

query.description: Search query for drugs, brands, categories

request.description: Hybrid smart search returning nav matches, products, brands, etc.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Search drugs by name or brand. Supports pagination with 'page' and 'per_page' parameters (default: 15 per page). Also accepts 'query' parameter as alias for 'q'.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get drug details by ID
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get multiple drugs by IDs

Public endpoint - requires API key. List all pharmacy drugs with pricing and availability information. Supports pagination. Response includes: id, drugId, drug_price_id, name (drug name with strength), description, price, inStock, stockQuantity, category (array), image, predefinedQuantities, brands, forms, requiresPrescription

response.name: Example Response

item.name: List Pharmacy Drugs by Pharmacy ID

request.description: Public endpoint - requires API key. List drugs for a specific pharmacy. Supports pagination.
Get user's saved drugs. Supports pagination.
drugId/brandId
Public endpoint - requires API key. Returns globally recent drugs (or user-specific if authenticated). Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get top searched drugs globally. Supports pagination.
Get user's recently viewed drugs. Supports pagination. Also accepts 'limit' parameter for backward compatibility.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Search pharmacies that have specific drugs. Pass drugs as JSON string in query parameter.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get all pharmacy prices. Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get prices for a specific pharmacy. Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get prices for a specific drug across all pharmacies. Supports pagination. Optional: include_pharmacy (default: true), lat/lng for distance calculation.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get all drug forms. Supports pagination.

item.name: Cart
item.description: Manage user shopping cart. Items are grouped by pharmacy.

request.description:
# 🛒 Get Cart

Retrieve current cart items.

### Response Structure
Items are grouped by pharmacy since orders are processed per-pharmacy.

```json
{
  "pharmacies": [
    {
      "pharmacy_id": 1,
      "pharmacy_name": "HealthPlus",
      "items": [...],
      "subtotal": 100
    }
  ],
  "total": 100,
  "total_items": 2
}
```

# ➕ Add Item

Add a drug to the cart.

### Fields
- `pharmacy_drug_price_id`: **Required**. The ID of the specific price/stock listing from a pharmacy (not just the drug ID).
- `quantity`: **Required**. Min 1, Max 99.

### Logic
- If item exists, updates quantity (if allowed).
- Checks stock before adding.

# ✏️ Update Quantity

Update the quantity of a cart item.

# 🗑️ Remove Item

Remove a single item from the cart.

# 🧹 Clear Cart

Remove all items from the cart.

# 🔄 Sync Cart

Replace the server-side cart with a local cart (e.g., from Guest session).

### Warning
This **overwrites** existing cart items on the server.

item.name: Orders
item.description: Manage order creation, tracking, and history.

request.description:
# 📦 Create Order

Checkout items from the cart.

### Modes
1.  **Single Branch Checkout**: Provide `pharmacy_branch_id`. Only items from that branch are ordered.
2.  **Checkout All**: Omit `pharmacy_branch_id`. Creates multiple orders (one per branch).

### Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `phone_number` | string | **Required**. |
| `delivery_method` | enum | `pickup` or `delivery`. |
| `payment_method` | enum | `platform` (online) or `direct` (cash/POS). |
| `delivery_address` | string | Required if method is `delivery`. |
| `delivery_methods` | array | Map of `branch_id` -> method (for multi-checkout). |
| `payment_methods` | array | Map of `branch_id` -> method (for multi-checkout). |

query.description: Optional filter: pending, confirmed, processing, ready, out_for_delivery, completed, cancelled

request.description:
# 📜 Order History

List all orders placed by the user.

# 📄 Order Details

Get full details of a specific order, including items and status.

# 🚚 Track Order

Get tracking timeline.

### Response
- `current_step`: 1-6 integer.
- `total_steps`: 5 (Pickup) or 6 (Delivery).
- `status_history`: Array of status changes.

# 🚫 Cancel Order

Cancel a pending order.

### Restrictions
Cannot cancel if status is `completed` or `processed` (depending on policy).

# 📎 Upload Rx

Upload a prescription image/PDF for an order that requires it.
Creates a `Prescription` record linked to the order.

item.name: Prescriptions
item.description: Manage user prescriptions and associated drugs.

request.description:
# 📋 List Prescriptions

Get all prescriptions for the authenticated user.

### Response
Returns a list of prescriptions, ordered by latest created. Includes `drugs` count.

# ➕ Create Prescription

Create a new prescription record. This creates the "folder" to which you can add drugs later.

### Auto-Generation
If `prescription_number` is not provided, it is automatically generated (e.g., `RX-2024-1234`).

### Inputs
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `prescription_picture` | file | Image of the Rx. |
| `doctor_name` | string | Optional |
| `prescription_date` | date | Optional |
| `expiry_date` | date | Optional. Must be > prescription_date |
| `status` | string | `active` (default), `pending_approval`, `expired` |

# 📄 Prescription Details

Get full details including the list of drugs.

### Includes
*   `user` object
*   `drugs` array (with `drug`, `brand`, `form`, `uom` details)

# ✏️ Update Prescription

Update prescription details.

### Note on File Uploads
To update the picture, use `POST` with `_method: PUT` because standard PUT requests do not support `multipart/form-data` file uploads efficiently in some clients.

# 🗑️ Delete Prescription

Removes the prescription and its associated image.

# 💊 Add Single Drug

Add one medication to this prescription.

### Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `drug_id` | int | **Required**. ID of the generic drug. |
| `quantity` | int | **Required**. |
| `dose` | string | e.g. "500mg". |
| `brand_id` | int | Optional. Specific brand. |
| `form_id` | int | Optional. Tablet, Syrup, etc. |
| `frequency` | string | Optional. e.g. "1-0-1" |
| `duration` | string | Optional. e.g. "5 days" |

# 📦 Bulk Add Drugs

Add multiple medications at once.

### Usage
Useful when importing a full prescription.

### Body
Requires a `drugs` array containing objects with the same fields as the single add endpoint.

# 🔄 Bulk Update Drugs

Update existing drugs in the prescription.

### Requirement
Each object in the `drugs` array MUST include `prescription_drug_id` to identify which record to update.

# 📢 Request/Revoke

Toggle the `has_request` flag.

- `GET /request`: Sets `has_request = 1`
- `GET /revoke`: Sets `has_request = 0`

item.name: Reviews
item.description: User reviews for Pharmacies and Drugs.

query.description: Required: ID of the pharmacy or drug

request.description:
# 🌟 Get Reviews

Fetch reviews for a specific entity (Pharmacy or Drug).

# ✍️ Write Review

Submit a new review.

### Fields
| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `reviewable_type` | string | **Required**. `pharmacy` or `medication`. |
| `reviewable_id` | int | **Required**. ID of the entity. |
| `rating` | int | **Required**. 1-5. |
| `title` | string | **Required**. |
| `comment` | string | **Required**. |
| `order_id` | int | Optional. Links review to a verified purchase. |

# ✏️ Update Review

Modify your existing review.

# 🗑️ Delete Review

Permanently remove your review.

# 👍 Mark Helpful

Vote on a review's helpfulness. Toggle `is_helpful` to true/false.

# 📊 Review Stats

Get average rating and breakdown for an entity.

#  Get Testimonies

Fetch a list of active testimonies.

#  Submit Testimony

Submit a new testimony for approval.

# 📰 List Posts

Get latest blog posts with pagination.

# 📄 Read Post

Get full content of a blog post by its slug.

# 🔗 Related Posts

Get similar posts based on category/tags.

# 📂 Categories

List available blog categories.

# 🏷️ Tags

List available tags.

# 💬 Get Comments

List comments for a post.

# ❤️ Like Post

Toggle like status for a post. Works for guests (IP-based) and auth users.

# 🗨️ Post Comment

Add a comment to a post.

### Guest vs Auth
- **Guests**: Must provide `name` and `email`.
- **Auth Users**: `name` and `email` are nullable (taken from profile).

item.name: Consultations
item.description: Full lifecycle management of patient consultations.

formdata.description: Options: general, medication_review, chronic_disease, acute_illness, wellness, vaccination

request.description:
# 🩺 Create Consultation

Initiate a new consultation request.

### Workflow
Initial status is `pending`.

query.description: Search by subject, number, or patient info

request.description:
# 📋 List Consultations

Retrieve consultations with optional filters.

# 📄 Consultation Details

Get full details including `user`, `prescription`, and `diagnoses`.

# ✏️ Update Consultation

Modify details of an existing consultation.

# 💬 Respond

**Pharmacist Role Only**

Submit professional response and recommendations. Changes status to `responded`.

# ✅ Complete

Mark the consultation as finished. Status becomes `completed`.

# 🚫 Cancel

Cancel the consultation request.

# ⭐ Rate

Provide feedback after completion.

- `rating`: 1-5 integer

# 📊 Statistics

Get counts by status, priority, and ratings.
Stats for the last 24 hours.
Initialize Paystack transaction for an order.
Verify Paystack transaction by reference.

item.name: User Activity
item.description: Recent searches and recently viewed items.

request.description: Note: Route path inferred from controller method name `topSearchedDrugs` and standard conventions, but checked `routes/api.php` it likely maps to specific route. Wait, checking file... Actually let's trust the common patterns or use the one from route file if visible. In absence of explicit `top-searched-drugs` route seen in grep, I will assume it might be missing or named differently. Use `/recent-drugs` as confirmed.
Legacy endpoint using GET to store recent search.
